importantArticles.headline: PG&E (NYSE:PCG) recently announced Q1 2025 earnings, reporting increased sales of USD 5,983 million from USD 5,861 million the previous year, though net income declined to USD 607 million from USD 732 million. Despite the decrease in earnings per share from USD 0.34 to USD 0.28, the company's updated earnings guidance projects positivity, likely adding weight to PG&E's 8% share price increase over the last quarter. This aligns with broader market gains where major indexes experienced general...
importantArticles.title: PG&E (NYSE:PCG) Reports Q1 Earnings With US$607M Net Income; Updates 2025 Guidance

importantArticles.headline: The Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) recognizes April 26 as National Drone Safety Day. The nationwide campaign is dedicated to educating the public on the importance of safe drone operation in recreation and business operations.
importantArticles.title: PG&E's Aerial System Drone Fleet Supports Safe, Reliable Energy System

importantArticles.headline: Jefferies analyst Julien Dumoulin-Smith raised the firm’s price target on PG&E to $22 from $20 and keeps a Buy rating on the shares. With wildfire reform and enhancements expected late FY25, the firm’s outlook for PG&E “remains largely unchanged from February,” the analyst tells investors in a preview. Regulatory filings in FY25 stand to strengthen the company’s 9% EPS growth guidance through FY28, the analyst added. Published first on TheFly – the ultimate source for real-time, market-moving br
importantArticles.title: PG&E price target raised to $22 from $20 at Jefferies

importantArticles.headline: PCG's first-quarter earnings lag the Zacks Consensus Estimate, while revenues grow year over year. The company's 2025 adjusted EPS guidance remains unchanged.
importantArticles.title: PG&E Q1 Earnings Lower Than Expected, Revenues Increase Y/Y

importantArticles.headline: PG&E (PCG) delivered earnings and revenue surprises of -5.71% and 2.06%, respectively, for the quarter ended March 2025. Do the numbers hold clues to what lies ahead for the stock?
importantArticles.title: PG&E (PCG) Q1 Earnings and Revenues Miss Estimates

importantArticles.headline: On a per-share basis, the Oakland, California-based company said it had net income of 28 cents. Earnings, adjusted for amortization costs and non-recurring costs, came to 33 cents per share. The results fell short of Wall Street expectations.
importantArticles.title: PG&E: Q1 Earnings Snapshot

importantArticles.headline: PCG's Q1 results are likely to be hurt by the wildfire damage amid the benefits of reduced non-fuel O&M expenses.
importantArticles.title: PG&E Corporation to Report Q1 Earnings: Here's What to Expect

importantArticles.headline: For the fifth consecutive year, The PG&E Corporation Foundation (PG&E Foundation) will provide grants to support independent restaurant owners and their staffs. They are doing so through the California Restaurant Foundation's (CRF) Restaurants Care Resilience Fund. The grants will support a record number of restaurants in Northern and Central California this year.
importantArticles.title: Keeping Local Restaurants Cooking: The PG&E Corporation Foundation Funds Restaurants Care Resilience Grants

importantArticles.headline: Today, Pacific Gas and Electric Company (PG&E) and real estate developer Westbank announced two major milestones in the development of Silicon Valley's innovative net-zero community. PG&E infrastructure upgrades have begun, and Westbank has launched a global call for data center partners to join the initiative.
importantArticles.title: PG&E Begins Energy Infrastructure Upgrades to Bring San Jose's Net Zero Community to Life

importantArticles.headline: Building upon proven layers of protection that ensured no major wildfires resulted from the company's equipment in 2023 and 2024 and infused with technological innovation, Pacific Gas and Electric Company (PG&E) today shared its robust, risk-informed strategy to continue that progress in light of an ever-changing climate.
importantArticles.title: Three-Year Wildfire Mitigation Plan Builds Upon Proven Layers of Protection, Includes Nearly 1,100 Miles of Undergrounding and Further Integration of New Technologies

importantArticles.title: Three-Year Wildfire Mitigation Plan Builds Upon Proven Layers of Protection, Includes Nearly 1,100 Miles of Undergrounding and Further Integration of New Technologies

importantArticles.headline: Every day in Central and Northern California, underground utility lines are damaged due to homeowners and contractors failing to call 811 before starting digging projects. Not only is digging without knowing the location of underground lines dangerous, it can also result in expensive repairs and inconvenient outages. Pacific Gas and Electric Company (PG&E) is joining with others across the country during National Safe Digging Month to help raise awareness of the importance of calling 811 before
importantArticles.title: April is National Safe Digging Month, A Reminder to Call to 811 Before Any Size Digging Project, Large or Small

importantArticles.headline: Pacific Gas and Electric Company (PG&E) today announced its intent to award up to $43 million in Microgrid Incentive Program (MIP) grant funding for the development of nine new community-driven microgrids throughout its Northern and Central California service area. PG&E today also announced the opening of the application window for the second wave of MIP grant funding beginning April 3.
importantArticles.title: PG&E Advancing $43 Million for Nine New Community Microgrids in Northern California

importantArticles.headline: Pacific Gas and Electric Company (PG&E) today announced its intent to award up to $43 million in Microgrid Incentive Program (MIP) grant funding for the development of nine new community-driven microgrids throughout its Northern and Central California service area. PG&E today also announced the opening of the application window for the second wave of MIP grant funding beginning April 3.
importantArticles.title: PG&E Advancing $43 Million for Nine New Community Microgrids in Northern California
